author: Drew Taylor
title: Team behind popular Helen restaurant opening new seafood, raw bar in Birmingham
text:
WIAT Birmingham Team behind popular Helen restaurant opening new seafood, raw bar in Birmingham Drew Taylor Thu, December 26, 2024 at 7:19 PM UTC 1 min read
Team behind popular Helen restaurant opening new seafood, raw bar in Birmingham MARGARET, Ala. ( WIAT ) — A new seafood restaurant will be opening soon from the culinary team behind Helen in Birmingham.
Chef Rob McDaniel and his wife, Emily, recently announced their new restaurant Bayonet , a raw bar that will open early next year adjacent to Helen on 2nd Avenue North. In a press release announcing the new restaurant, Bayonet was described as having an “innovative menu of sustainably sourced seafood and raw bar offerings, served in a vibrant and lively atmosphere.”
Margaret City Councilor Darius Crump arrested, charged with domestic violence on Christmas Eve
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Guests at Bayonet can expect frequent menu changes with offerings such as salads, chowders, crudos, sandwiches, toasts, and “elevated entrees.”
Bayonet will be open 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. Monday through Saturday, offering an all-day menu starting at 11 a.m. with dinner options available beginning at 5 p.m. The beverage list includes an assortment of cocktails, champagnes, and different wines carefully chosen to pair with different seafood dishes.
“We’re excited to introduce Birmingham to an unexpected dining experience that’s as bold and vibrant as the seafood we serve,” McDaniel said in the statement. “Bayonet will challenge expectations by presenting new and creative ways to enjoy seafood while remaining approachable and fun.”
Since opening in 2020, Helen has received received critical praise around town and has been a popular destination for fine dining. In 2021, Esquire magazine named Helen as one of the best new restaurants in the country .

author: Merlin
title: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia au PSG : l'officialisation imminente !
text:
Après des semaines de négociations, le transfert de Khvicha Kvaratskhelia au Paris Saint-Germain est sur le point d’être officialisé, avec une arrivée à Paris ce jeudi. C’est officiel : le PSG et Naples ont trouvé un accord pour le transfert de Khvicha Kvaratskhelia, dont l’arrivée dans la capitale française est imminente. D’après Le Parisien, le Géorgien devrait arriver ce jeudi et passer sa visite médicale dès vendredi, avant l’officialisation de son transfert, attendue dans la foulée.
L’annonce devrait être faite après la conférence de presse de Luis Enrique, prévue vendredi à 13 heures, avant le déplacement à Lens. Toutefois, Kvaratskhelia ne sera pas qualifié pour ce match, et ses premiers pas sous les couleurs du PSG pourraient se faire le 25 janvier face à Reims.

author: , Tallahassee Democrat
title: Severe thunderstorms whip across Florida Panhandle with rain, hail
text: Severe thunderstorms, tornadoes warnings sweep across North Florida, here's where A line of showers and strong to severe thunderstorms continue to move eastward across [North Florida](https://www.pnj.com/story/weather/2024/05/08/severe-weather-possible-thursday-and-early-friday/73612378007/) Friday with the potential to spin up tornadoes, forecasters said. "Damaging to destructive winds, isolated tornadoes, and large hail will be the main threats," the [National Weather Service in Tallahassee](https://www.weather.gov/tae/) predicted. Heavy rainfall could also become a concern if redevelopment and training of storms occurs behind this complex of storms this afternoon." Tallahassee officials have told students to [stay home from school until the storm threat](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2024/05/10/leon-county-under-tornado-warnings-as-severe-storms-sweep-across-area-tallahassee-weather/73638607007/) has passed. More than [100,000 power outages were reported](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/weather/2024/05/10/florida-thunderstorms-wind-florida-power-outages/73638804007/). In the west Panhandle, winds up to 70 mph are expected along with hail "up to golf ball size," the National Weather Service in Alabama said. "A tornado or two cannot be ruled out but confidence is low in the tornado potential." Parts of the Panhandle Bay, Walton and Washington counties were under a tornado warning Friday morning until 5:15 a.m. A line of severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Chattahoochee to 14 miles northwest of Stonemill Creek to 9 miles southwest of Panama City, moving east at 70 mph, the NWS said. "Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings." Jackson, Gulf, Bay and Calhoun counties in the Panhandle and Wakulla, Gadsden, Liberty, Taylor, Jefferson, Leon, Franklin and Madison counties in the Big Bend are under a severe thunderstorm warning until 7:45 a.m. EDT. A severe thunderstorm watch is in effect until 11 a.m. EDT for Bay, Calhoun, Dixie, Franklin, Gadsden, Gulf, Holmes, Jackson, Jefferson, Lafayette, Leon, Liberty, Madison, Taylor, Wakulla, Walton and Washington counties and until noon EDT for Alachua, Baker, Bradford, Clay, Columbia, Duval, Flagler, Gilchrist, Hamilton, Levy, Marion, Nassau, Putnam, St. Johns, Suwannee and Union. "On Friday, the remainder of the front will move off most of the Atlantic Coast, while parts of the boundary will linger over Florida on Saturday," [National Weather Service forecaster Paul Ziegenfelder](https://www.wpc.ncep.noaa.gov/discussions/hpcdiscussions.php?disc=pmdspd) said Thursday. The storms are not expected to be nearly as powerful or dangerous as the [severe weather that ripped through Tennessee](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/weather/2024/05/08/tennessee-severe-thunderstorm-tornado-deaths-injuries/73622062007/) Wednesday that was responsible for the deaths of at least two people. Local forecasts predict thunderstorms and showers passing over North Florida Friday, bringing up to an inch of rain. However, AccuWeather warns that airports in major metro areas from Washington, D.C. down to Birmingham, Alabama may experience lengthy delays and possible flight cancellations for people traveling ahead of Mother's Day on Sunday. Severe thunderstorms in North Florida Florida Power outages in Tallahassee and the Panhandle [More than 111,000 power outages](https://data.tallahassee.com/national-power-outage-map-tracker/area/florida/12/) were reported across Florida Friday morning as [severe thunderstorms swept across the northern part of the state](https://www.tallahassee.com/story/weather/2024/05/10/severe-thunderstorms-friday-florida-panhandle-hail-tornadoes/73638524007/). Weather alerts issued in Florida [Weather radar and forecast for Pensacola](https://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=30.47353 4&lon=-87.18663 5#.Y7bHEXbMKUk) [Weather radar and forecast for Tallahassee](https://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=30.4398&lon=-84.2806#.Y7bHf3bMKUk) [Weather radar and forecast for Jacksonville](https://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=30.3315&lon=-81.6562#.Y7bIGnbMKUk) Contributing: Cheryl McCloud, USA TODAY Network-Florida

author: En réponse à
title: Marseille : un individu en état d’ébriété interpellé après avoir agressé un passant au couteau en hurlant « Allah Akbar ». L’homme a été interné de force en hôpital psychiatrique
text: Un homme a été interpellé mardi 26 décembre à Marseille, soupçonné d’avoir agressé un passant au couteau en pleine journée. Les faits se sont produits aux alentours de 15 heures, le long de l’avenue Schuman, dans le 2e arrondissement de la ville. Le mis en cause, en état d’ébriété avéré, a été entendu hurlant «Allah Akbar». Placé en garde à vue, il a fait l’objet d’une admission en soins psychiatriques. D’après une source policière, l’individu suspect a été interpellé sans faire de blessé. La personne menacée avait déjà quitté les lieux à l’arrivée des forces de l’ordre. Les policiers ont transporté le mis en cause au commissariat de Noailles pour le soumettre à un test d’alcoolémie, mais il n’a pas réussi à souffler dans la machine et a été placé en garde à vue. Contacté, le parquet de Marseille a indiqué au Figaro que l’homme a finalement fait l’objet d’une admission en soins psychiatriques sans consentement, c’est-à-dire interné de force. [https://www.fdesouche.com/2023/12/28/marseille-un-individu-en-etat-debriete-interpelle-apres-avoir-agresse-un-passant-au-couteau-en-hurlant-allah-akbar-lhomme-a-ete-interne-de-force-en-hopital-psychiatrique/](https://www.fdesouche.com/2023/12/28/marseille-un-individu-en-etat-debriete-interpelle-apres-avoir-agresse-un-passant-au-couteau-en-hurlant-allah-akbar-lhomme-a-ete-interne-de-force-en-hopital-psychiatrique/)

author: Alexandra Sharp
title: Thousands in Indonesia Protest Proposed Election Law Changes
text:
Welcome back to World Brief, where we’re looking at backlash over Indonesia ’s proposed electoral changes, the last day of the U.S. Democratic National Convention, and a major railway strike across Canada .
Sign up to receive World Brief in your inbox every weekday. Sign up to receive World Brief in your inbox every weekday. Enter your email Sign Up ✓ Signed Up Unsubscribe By submitting your email, you agree to the Privacy Policy and Terms of Use and to receive email correspondence from us. You may opt out at any time. By submitting your email, you agree to the Privacy Policy and Terms of Use and to receive email correspondence from us. You may opt out at any time.
Parliament Caves to Protests Thousands of Indonesians attempted to storm the country’s parliament building in the capital of Jakarta on Thursday during protests against proposed changes to the country’s election laws. Police fired tear gas and water cannons at protesters, some of whom carried a mock guillotine featuring the face of outgoing President Joko Widodo. Similar demonstrations erupted across other major cities, including Bandung, Yogyakarta, Surabaya, and Makassar.
Indonesian lawmakers were meeting in an emergency session to ratify legislation to overturn one ruling that the country’s Constitutional Court made earlier this week and to amend a second. If passed, the legislation would have expanded the political influence of Widodo and his successor, Prabowo Subianto , by letting Widodo’s son run for a regional deputy governor position and potentially paving the way for allies of Widodo and Prabowo to contest elections in Central Java and Jakarta virtually unopposed. Protesters called on the parliamentarians to respect the two court rulings.
The first ruling, on Tuesday, dismissed a case challenging age limits on people under 30 seeking regional governorships. Parliament wished to change the limits, allowing Widodo’s youngest son, 29-year-old Kaesang Pangarep, to run for office in Central Java.
Kaesang would not be the only member of Widodo’s family in power were he to win a seat come November. Widodo’s eldest son, Gibran Rakabuming Raka, will be sworn in as vice president on Oct. 20 alongside Prabowo. Gibran was only allowed to run for vice president due to the Constitutional Court ruling last October that people under age 40 could run for the top offices if they had previously been elected to a regional post.
Critics of Widodo’s administration denounced that ruling, arguing that then-Chief Justice Anwar Usman should not have participated in the case because he is Widodo’s brother-in-law. Anwar was later dismissed over the controversy.
Also on Tuesday, the Constitutional Court ruled in favor of abolishing a threshold rule that required political parties and coalitions to hold 20 percent of legislative seats or 25 percent of the popular vote in order to nominate candidates for regional heads, the highest such threshold in the world. The court issued a new stipulation saying parties and coalitions need just 7.5 percent of the popular vote for provinces with 6 million to 12 million eligible voters and only 6 percent of the popular vote for provinces with more than 12 million eligible voters.
Activists hailed the ruling as a win for democracy, arguing that the decision hinders the Onward Indonesia Coalition’s efforts to create a broad coalition to prevent opposition candidate Anies Baswedan from running for the coveted governorship of Jakarta. But lawmakers aimed to amend the ruling on Thursday to once again raise the nomination threshold.
Legal experts and political analysts have described these power struggles as bordering on a constitutional crisis for the world’s third-largest democracy and fourth most populous country. Widodo has downplayed these amendments, though, calling them just part of government “checks and balances.”
Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, the deputy speaker of Indonesia’s House of Representatives, ultimately postponed Thursday’s emergency plenary session over the unrest, first citing the body’s failure to meet a quorum before caving to protesters’ demands. The vote won’t be held until parliament’s next sitting period, meaning that any possible changes to the court’s decisions would not apply to Widodo’s outgoing administration or regional elections slated for November.

author: rozellascruggs
title: Exploring the Benefits of Green Vein Kratom Strains
text:
Read Time: 4 Minute, 41 Second Originating from Southeast Asia, Kratom (Mitragyna speciosa) is known for its potential therapeutic benefits, particularly in managing pain, boosting energy, and promoting relaxation. Of the three primary Kratom strains—red, white, and green—Green Vein Kratom is increasingly popular as a result of its balanced effects, making it suitable for each newcomers and experienced users alike. Right here’s an in-depth exploration of the potential benefits of Green Vein Kratom and the way it can enhance day by day wellness.
1. A Balanced Increase of Energy and Relaxation
One of many unique traits of Green Vein Kratom is its ability to provide a balanced expertise of both energy and relaxation. Unlike White Vein Kratom, which is usually related with high energy and stimulation, and Red Vein Kratom, which is known for its enjoyable and pain-relieving effects, Green Vein Kratom gives a center ground. This balance makes it perfect for customers who wish to really feel alert and centered without the jittery effects usually related with caffeine or stimulants.
In low to moderate doses, Green Vein Kratom can help enhance energy levels, improve focus, and enhance mental clarity, making it suitable for a busy workday or a mentally demanding task. As the dose increases, nevertheless, its effects tend to lean more towards relaxation, which might be helpful for unwinding after a long day without causing the sedation usually skilled with Red Vein Kratom.
2. Enhanced Mental Clarity and Focus
Green Vein Kratom has a popularity for helping customers improve their mental focus and clarity. It may be particularly beneficial for individuals who battle with staying targeted on tasks or are easily distracted. Green Kratom strains help promote mental endurance, making them useful for prolonged durations of work or research sessions.
Many customers report that they really feel a heightened sense of awareness and alertness without the anxious side effects related with different stimulants. This makes Green Vein Kratom an excellent option for these looking to enhance productivity or handle tasks that require sustained attention. By stimulating the mind and sharpening focus, Green Vein Kratom might be a valuable natural various to traditional focus-enhancing supplements.
3. Mood Enhancement and Social Confidence
Green Vein Kratom can be praised for its mood-boosting qualities. It helps in creating a sense of well-being and positivity, which might be especially helpful for individuals dealing with stress, anxiety, or temper-associated challenges. Unlike another forms of Kratom, Green Vein Kratom is known to uplift the temper without inflicting overwhelming stimulation or drowsiness, making it a perfect daytime option.
For many who experience social anxiousness, Green Vein Kratom can also help by reducing feelings of nervousness and increasing social confidence. Many users discover that it helps them feel more at ease in social settings, enhancing their overall social experiences without the cloudiness that some other sedative herbs can bring. This property has made Green Vein Kratom popular among these looking to improve their social interactions or ease communication in high-stress environments.
4. Natural Pain Reduction with Functionality
One of the popular makes use of of Kratom, in general, is for pain relief, and Green Vein Kratom is not any exception. It has analgesic properties that can assist manage delicate to moderate pain, making it a terrific alternative for those who need aid without the heavy sedative effects of Red Vein Kratom. Many individuals with chronic pain conditions discover that Green Vein Kratom provides effective aid while still allowing them to stay functional and productive.
Green Vein Kratom’s pain-relieving effects are as a result of alkaloids mitragynine and seven-hydroxymitragynine, which interact with opioid receptors in the brain, producing analgesic effects without the risk of dependency related with traditional opioids. As such, it gives a natural various for pain relief with the added benefit of alertness, which is especially useful for daytime use.
5. Enhanced Physical Endurance and Motivation
In addition to mental clarity and focus, Green Vein Kratom is valued by many for its potential to enhance physical endurance. Athletes and fitness fans usually turn to Green Vein Kratom for its capacity to improve motivation, stamina, and endurance throughout workouts. Its balanced energy-boosting properties mean it can provide the necessary drive to stay active without inflicting the anxious energy spikes that may come with different energy supplements.
6. An Accessible Option for New Kratom Users
For those new to Kratom, Green Vein strains offer a more moderate experience that combines the very best of each Red and White Vein Kratom. They’re less likely to produce excessive effects, making them a super starting level for beginners who wish to expertise Kratom’s benefits without feeling overwhelmed. With Green Vein Kratom, new users can explore its potential to improve their focus, mood, and energy levels at a comfortable pace.
Conclusion
Green Vein Kratom is a versatile and balanced strain that provides a wide range of potential benefits. From enhancing focus and mood to providing natural pain reduction and boosting physical endurance, Green Vein Kratom is a suitable alternative for these looking to improve their each day wellness naturally. As with any supplement, it’s essential to start with a low dose to understand how your body responds and consult with a healthcare professional, especially if in case you have any pre-current health conditions. For those looking for a natural answer that balances energy with rest, Green Vein Kratom may very well be a valuable addition to their wellness routine.

author: Ximena Cordova
title: México espera frío polar: estas son las fechas y regiones más afectadas
text: La temporada de frío en México está a la vuelta de la esquina, y los cambios en la circulación atmosférica ya anticipan la llegada de masas polares que modificarán el clima en distintas zonas del país. Aunque algunas regiones han experimentado heladas y frío matutino, el calor intenso persiste en el noroeste, donde los termómetros alcanzan los 40°C. Sin embargo, el frío polar podría llegar pronto, afectando a la mayoría de las entidades. También te podría interesar: Clima en México: Frente frío y onda tropical traen temperaturas de -10° C este día de Halloween Durante octubre, el debilitamiento del vórtice polar permitió que masas de aire frío y seco alcanzaran el Altiplano, generando las primeras heladas y temperaturas de hasta -5°C en zonas de Hidalgo, Puebla, Tlaxcala y Veracruz. Este fenómeno fue favorecido por una Oscilación Ártica (AO) en fase negativa, que permitió el ingreso del aire polar a México. Sin embargo, a mediados de octubre, el vórtice se fortaleció nuevamente, deteniendo temporalmente la llegada de nuevas masas de aire frío. Para la última semana de octubre, se prevé que el vórtice polar estratosférico se elongue en dirección a Norteamérica, permitiendo que el frío se desplace hacia Estados Unidos y, posiblemente, hacia México. La Oscilación Ártica también cambiará a una fase neutra-negativa, lo que podría hacer que el frío avance hacia el sur, afectando el norte y centro del país. El Servicio Meteorológico Nacional ha pronosticado un total de 48 frentes fríos para la temporada 2024-2025, que va de septiembre a mayo, una cifra ligeramente menor al promedio. Hasta ahora, se han registrado cuatro de estos frentes, pero para finales de octubre se espera la llegada de un nuevo sistema, que alcanzaría Baja California, Sonora y Chihuahua. Este frente no será especialmente intenso, pero contribuirá a moderar las temperaturas en estas zonas, dejando atrás el calor extremo y dando paso a mañanas frescas. Para noviembre, se espera que el vórtice polar estratosférico se fortalezca y extienda su influencia hacia América del Norte y Eurasia. Este cambio aumentará la posibilidad de que las masas polares recorran el territorio mexicano, provocando descensos más notorios en la temperatura. Además, la Oscilación del Pacífico Este (EPO) podría entrar en fase negativa, promoviendo el desplazamiento del frío ártico hacia Canadá, Estados Unidos y México. A medida que el frío avance hacia México, no todas las regiones se verán afectadas de la misma manera. Los estados del norte, noreste, centro, oriente y sureste sentirán los efectos más fuertes de las masas polares y los frentes fríos, especialmente en el Altiplano, donde la altitud intensifica las bajas temperaturas. En cambio, en los estados costeros y el noroeste, los efectos serán menos intensos, aunque también podrían experimentar días frescos o fríos en noviembre. También te podría interesar: Frente frío y onda tropical traerán lluvias intensas y temperaturas de -10 °C en México para Día de Muertos informa Conagua Para noviembre, se espera que el frío sea más constante en las regiones antes mencionadas, y hacia mediados o finales del mes podría intensificarse, abarcando gran parte del territorio mexicano. Señalando de esta forma que este patrón podría mantenerse hasta diciembre. En resumen, los efectos de la temporada de frentes fríos se sentirán principalmente en el norte y centro del país, extendiéndose gradualmente al oriente y sureste. Los habitantes de estas regiones deberán prepararse para un clima más frío, heladas matutinas y días nublados a medida que avance el mes de noviembre."} {"@type":"BreadcrumbList

author: Larry Elder
title: Larry Elder: California is where common sense goes to die
text:
The circus came to California a long time ago, and there are no signs it’s packing up any time soon. Some recent examples:
California lawmakers set up a reparations panel for “black descendants of slaves” even though California was never a slave state. California has a budget deficit of close to $50 billion, and some put the price tag of the panel’s reparations recommendations at $800 billion.
A former soap opera actor recently was shot and killed in downtown Los Angeles. He interrupted thieves attempting to steal the catalytic converter from his car. In response, a Democrat Los Angeles City Council member — there are no Republicans — blamed the automaker for failing to make the catalytic converters harder to steal. Councilwoman Nithya Raman said: “In this case, I think one of the things that infuriates me, is that we have a company — whatever, Toyota — who makes the Prius, that essentially has a device on their cars which is super easy to remove. It’s basically the value of a MacBook, right?”
At a gay pride parade in West Hollywood, some “indigenous queer people” marched waving a Mexican flag with a Palestinian flag on the bumper of their truck. A gay man in Gaza told i24News: “If you are gay, you should be hiding. It’s so hard. I was so scared. Scared from everything you know? Scared of getting hit, of getting kidnapped. I was so afraid. I was afraid Hamas would find out I was gay.”
California voters in 1996 banned the use of race and gender in government hiring, government contracts and admission to state colleges and universities. Yet, the University of California, Los Angeles medical school dean of admissions, Jennifer Lucero, a proponent of “diversity, equity and inclusion,” ignores the law and lowers standards to admit “underrepresented” students. According to The Washington Free Beacon: “Within three years of Lucero’s hiring in 2020, UCLA dropped from 6th the 18th place in U.S. News & World Report’s rankings for medical research. And … more than 50 percent of students failed standardized tests on emergency medicine, family medicine, internal medicine, and pediatrics.”
In 2018, California lawmakers passed and the governor, a Democrat — there are no Republicans holding any statewide office — signed a law requiring publicly traded corporations headquartered in California to have at least one woman on their boards of directors. In 2020, lawmakers passed a law requiring publicly traded corporations headquartered in California to have one member from an “underrepresented community,” defined as “individuals who self-identify as Black, African-American, Hispanic, Latino, Asian, Pacific Islander, Native American, Native Hawaiian, or Alaska Native, or who self-identify as gay, lesbian, bisexual or transgender.” California courts struck down both laws as violations of the equal protection clause of the California Constitution.
Related Articles Opinion Columnists | Social Security reform is coming (really) and will bring political rewards Opinion Columnists | California seeks a more resilient water supply as familiar sides battle for access Opinion Columnists | California homelessness funding is on the chopping block. Will it make the final budget? Opinion Columnists | Los Angeles’ homelessness policies are a disaster Opinion Columnists | Why California regulators have to protect both consumers and company profits In April, California’s $20 hourly minimum wage went into effect for fast-food workers. UCLA economist Lee Ohanian estimates the law, so far, has cost the state 10,000 fast-food jobs. The law also incentivizes the use of automation. California last year had the lowest job growth of any state. As of April 2024, California, at 5.3%, had the highest rate of unemployment of any state.
When the governor signed the fast-food law, two major California Pizza Hut franchisees promptly let go more than 1,200 delivery workers. Rubio’s Coastal Grill, a fish taco chain, just closed all 48 California locations. The company said: “The closings were brought about by the rising cost of doing business in California.” Note that most franchise operators are “mom-and-pop” owners, with just one location running on thin profit margins. So, this 25% hike in the minimum wage bites hard. As for the law’s sticker shock, Wendy’s increased its prices 8%, Chipotle 7.5% and Starbucks 7%.
But things could have been worse. Democrat U.S. Senate candidate Barbara Lee advocates a $50 hourly minimum wage.
Larry Elder is a bestselling author and nationally syndicated radio talk-show host. To find out more about Larry Elder, or become an “Elderado,” visit www.LarryElder.com. Follow Larry on Twitter @larryelder.
